<p>Discontinue thrombolytic therapy if life-threatening bleeding occurs. Treat blood loss with whole blood, packed red blood cells, and/or fresh frozen plasma. IV aminocaproic acid (Amicar) should be available for administration in the event of excessive fibrinolysis.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Following thrombolytic therapy, administer heparin or aspirin as prescribed to decrease the risk of rethrombosis.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Following thrombolytic therapy, administer beta blockers as prescribed to decrease myocardial oxygen consumption and to reduce the incidence and severity of reperfusion arrhythmias.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Administer H2 antagonists, such as ranitidine (Zantac), or proton pump inhibitors, such as omeprazole (Prilosec), as prescribed to prevent GI bleeding.</p>
</li>
<li></li>
</ul>
<p>Anti platelets drugs</p>
<ul>
<li>These are agents that decrease the formation of platelet plug by decreasing their responsiveness to various stimuli that would cause them to risk and combine together on a vessel wall.</li>
</ul>
<p>This include;</p>
<ul>
<li>Acetyl salicylic acid (aspirin)</li>
<li>Thienopyridine analogues</li>
</ul>
<p>Ticlopidine,</p>
<p>Clopidogrel</p>
<ul>
<li>Glycoprotein receptor antagonist:</li>
</ul>
<p>Abciximab</p>
<p>Eptifibatide</p>
<p>Tirofiban</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="mechanism-of-action-of-platelet-inhibitors">mechanism of action of platelet inhibitors<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#mechanism-of-action-of-platelet-inhibitors" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>these agents inhibit the aggregation of platelets in the clotting process by blocking receptor sites on the platelets membrane, preventing platelet to platelet interaction, there by prolonging the bleeding time.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="acetyl-salicylic-acid-aspirin">Acetyl salicylic acid (aspirin)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#acetyl-salicylic-acid-aspirin" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Universally accepted anti platelet drug.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="mechanism-of-action">Mechanism of action<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#mechanism-of-action" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Irreversibly causes inhibition of cyclooxygenase (COX) that leads to formation of thromboxane A2 and prostacyclin.</li>
<li>TXA2 is the key platelet activator inhibition of platelets action.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="therapeutic-uses">Therapeutic Uses<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#therapeutic-uses" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Primary prevention of acute myocardial infarction</li>
<li>Prevention of reinfarction in clients following an acute myocardial infarction</li>
<li>Prevention of stroke</li>
<li>Acute coronary syndromes (abciximab, tirofiban, eptifibatide)</li>
<li>Intermittent claudication (cilostazol, pentoxifylline, dipyridamole)</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="route-of-administration">Route of administration<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#route-of-administration" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Aspirin: Oral</li>
<li>Abciximab: IV</li>
<li>Clopidogrel: Oral</li>
<li>Pentoxifylline: Oral</li>
</ul>
<p>Side/Adverse Effects Nursing Interventions/Client Education</p>
<ul>
<li>Aspirin GI effects (nausea, vomiting, dyspepsia) Advise clients to use enteric-coated tablets and to take aspirin with food. Concurrent use of a proton pump inhibitor, such as omeprazole (Prilosec), may be appropriate.</li>
<li>Hemorrhagic stroke</li>
<li>Prolonged bleeding time, gastric bleed, thrombocytopenia</li>
<li>Tinnitus, hearing loss</li>
</ul>
<p>Nursing Administration</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Advise clients that prevention of strokes, myocardial infarctions, and reinfarction can be accomplished with low-dose aspirin (81 mg).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Aspirin 325 mg should be taken during initial acute episode of myocardial infarction</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Advise clients to notify the provider regarding aspirin use.</p>
</li>
<li></li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="thienopyridine-analogues">Thienopyridine analogues<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#thienopyridine-analogues" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="clopidogre-and-ticlopidine">Clopidogre and ticlopidine<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#clopidogre-and-ticlopidine" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Clopidogre and ticlopidine reduces platelets aggregation by inhibiting the ADP pathway of platelets.</li>
<li>These drugs achieved their antiplatelet effects by irreversibly blocking the ADP receptor on platelets.</li>
<li>unlike aspirin, these drugs have no effects on prostaglandin metabolism.</li>
<li>Important for aspirin intolerant</li>
<li>Use of clopidogre or ticlopidine to prevent thrombosis is now considered standard practice in patients undergoing placement of coronary stent.</li>
<li>Clopidogrel plus aspirin is used for long term treatment of severe cases of coronary syndromes.</li>
<li>Rashes caused by ticlopidine.</li>
</ul>
<p>Hemostatic agents/ coagulants</p>
<ul>
<li>Haemostatic agents help to stop bleeding at the local site.thus enhancing and promoting coagulation and formation of network fibrin around the wound.</li>
</ul>
<p>These drugs are :</p>
<p>Aminocaproic acid and tranexamic</p>
<ul>
<li>These are fibrin stabilizers that maintain or stabilize the clot in the bleeding vessels.</li>
</ul>
<p>Protamine sulfate</p>
<ul>
<li>This agent antagonizes the anticoagulant effects of heparin.</li>
<li>It is derived from fish testis and is high in arginine content.</li>
<li>The positive charge interacts with the negative charge of heparin to form a stable inactive complex.</li>
</ul>
<p>Drugs for various bleeding conditions</p>
<p>• epistasis – adrenaline</p>
<p>• Overdose of fibrinolytic, bleeding post surgery – aminocaproic acid</p>
<p>• Menorrhagia, metrorrhagia – adrenochrome, ethamesylate.</p>
<p>• PPH – carboprost</p>
<p>Vitamin K</p>
<p>Is a fat soluble vitamin occurs in two forms :</p>
<p>vitamin K1 (phytonadione):leafy vegetables</p>
<p>Vitamin k2 (menadione): GIT through microbes.</p>
<p>Bile salts are required for absorption of vitamin K from the intestines.</p>
<p>VIT .K cont.</p>
<p>Deficiency occurs due to two conditions</p>
<p>• Prolonged gut sterilization. VIT. K2</p>
<p>• Obstructive jaundice. VIT. K1, K2.</p>
<p>Phytonadione</p>
<p>may be given orally, IM, IV</p>
<p>if given orally give with bile salts.</p>
<p>Menadione sodium bisulphate</p>
<p>Oral, IM ,IV, or SC</p>
<p>does not require bile salts</p>
<p>Takes longer duration</p>
<p>Vitamin K is given to antagonize oral anticoagulants.</p>
<p>The response to vitamin K is slow, requiring about 24 hours thus, if immediate hemostasis or bleeding control is required, fresh frozen plasma should be ordered.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="therapeutic-uses">Therapeutic uses<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#therapeutic-uses" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Vitamin K deficiency.</li>
<li>Treatment of hemorrhagic disease of the newborn.</li>
<li>newborn and premature to cover the reduced intestinal synthesis.</li>
<li>Prolonged anti microbial therapeutic activity.</li>
<li>Obstructive jaundice.</li>
<li>malabsorption</li>
</ul>
<p>hematinic</p>
<p>a hematinic is a nutrient required in the formation of blood cells the main hematinic are iron , B12 and Folate. deficiency can lead to anemia</p>
<p>Iron and iron salts</p>
<p>• Iron deficiency is the most common nutritional anaemia in humans</p>
<p>• It result from inadequate iron intake, malabsorption, blood loss, or an increased requirement as with pregnancy.</p>
<p>• When severe it results in microcytic hypochromic anemia.</p>
<p>Ferrous sulphate</p>
<p>pharmacokinetics</p>
<p>Iron is given orally as a ferrous salt 50 -100MG is administered daily for the treatment of anemia .</p>
<p>Iron is absorbed readily in presence of gastric acid.</p>
<p>Ferrous sulphate cont.'</p>
<ul>
<li>It is given before meals though many patients cannot tolerate it due to its irritating effects.</li>
<li>After sometime the patient shows improved appetite, increased erythrocyte cell count and decreased microcytic hypochromic anaemia .</li>
<li>At lest six months of therapy is necessary to restore iron levels to storage site.</li>
<li>It can be given parenterally as iron dextran or iron sucrose that is by slow im or iv.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id=""><span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"></span></h1></div>
<p>Unwanted effects</p>
<ul>
<li>Oral can cause GIT discomfort</li>
<li>Liquid form for infants can stain teeth.</li>
<li>Allergic reactions are possible with chills, urticaria, sweating , fever and even anaphylaxis after parenteral administration.</li>
<li>Patients pass black or dark stool this in harmless results of unabsorbed iron.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id=""><span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="folic-acid">folic acid<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#folic-acid" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="expected-pharmacological-action">Expected Pharmacological Action<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#expected-pharmacological-action" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Folic acid is essential in the production of DNA and erythropoiesis (RBC, WBC, and platelets).</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="therapeutic-uses">Therapeutic Uses<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#therapeutic-uses" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Treatment of megaloblastic (macrocytic) anemia secondary to folic acid deficiency</li>
<li>Prevention of neural tube defects during pregnancy; therefore it is needed in all women of child-bearing age who may become pregnant.</li>
<li>Treatment of malabsorption syndrome such as sprue</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="contraindications-precautions">Contraindications/Precautions .<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#contraindications-precautions" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Indiscriminate use of folic acid is inappropriate because of the risk of masking signs of vitamin B12 deficiency.</p>
<p>Medication/Food Interactions</p>
<p>• Decreased folate levels with concurrent use of sulfonamides, sulfasalazine, or methotrexate.</p>
<p>Nursing Administration</p>
<p>• Assess clients for signs and symptoms of megaloblastic anemia (pallor, easy fatigability, palpitations, paresthesia of hands or feet).</p>
<p>• Obtain the client’s baseline folic acid levels, RBC and reticulocyte counts, Hgb, and Hct levels. Monitor periodically.</p>
<p>• Advise clients with folic acid deficiency to concurrently increase intake of food sources of folic acid, such as green leafy vegetables and liver. Monitor clients for risk factors indicating that folic acid therapy may be needed, such as heavy alcohol use and child-bearing age.</p>
<p>NB :vitamin B12 will be covered in nutrition.</p>
<p>Insulin, oral hypoglycemic agents</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Overview</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Diabetes mellitus is a chronic illness that results from an absolute or relative deficiency of insulin.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Various insulins are available to manage diabetes. These medications differ in their onset, peak, and duration.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Oral hypoglycemic agents work in various ways to increase available insulin or modify carbohydrate metabolism.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Newer injectable medication are used to supplement insulin or oral agents to manage glucose control.</p>
</li>
<li></li>
</ul>
<p>Review regulation of insulin secretion and its function in control of blood glucose level from A/P.</p>
<p>diabetes mellitus and effects of insulin</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>DM consists of agroup of disorders characterized hyperglycemia, altered metabolism of lipids, carbohydrates and proteins and increased complications from vascular diseases.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Most patients can be classified clinically as having either type1 or type 2 DM.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The criteria for the diagnosis of DM include symptoms (e.g.polyuria, polydipsia, and unexplained weight loss)and a random plasma glucose concentration of greater than 200ml/dl )11.1mmol.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>A fasting plasma glucose of greater than (126ml/dl) 7mmol</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>there two types of DM . DM TYPE 1 and DM TYPE 2</p>
</li>
<li></li>
</ul>
<p>Insulin Therapy</p>
<ul>
<li>Insulin polypeptide hormone is the mainstay for treatment</li>
<li>Of all types of diabetes.</li>
<li>Insulin may be administered IM , IV, SC.</li>
<li>long term treatment relies on subcutaneous injections of the hormone.</li>
</ul>
<p>Expected Pharmacological Action
✓ Promotes cellular uptake of glucose (decreases glucose levels)
✓ Converts glucose into glycogen
✓ Moves potassium into cells (along with glucose)</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id=""><span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"></span></h1></div>
<p>Therapeutic Uses</p>
<p>• Insulin is used for glycemic control of diabetes mellitus (type 1, type 2, gestational) to prevent complications.</p>
<p>• Clients with type 2 diabetes mellitus may require insulin when:</p>
<p>• Oral hypoglycemic, diet, and exercise are unable to control blood glucose levels.</p>
<p>✓ Severe renal or liver disease is present.</p>
<p>✓ Painful neuropathy is present.</p>
<p>✓ Undergoing surgery or diagnostic tests.</p>
<p>✓Experiencing severe stress such as infection and trauma.</p>
<p>✓Undergoing emergency treatment of diabetes ketoacidosis (DKA) and hyperosmolar hyperglycemic nonketotic syndrome (HHNS).</p>
<p>✓ Requiring treatment of hyperkalemia.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="classification-of-insulin-classified-according-to-duration-of-action">Classification of insulin; classified according to duration of action<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#classification-of-insulin-classified-according-to-duration-of-action" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>|  classification | Generic
(trade name) | Onset | Peak | duration  |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  Rapid acting | Lispro insulin
(Humalog), Insulin
aspart (NovoLog),
Insulin glulisine
(Apidra) | Less than 15 min | Less than 15 min 0.5
to 1 hr. | 3 to 4 hr.  |
|  Short acting | - Regular insulin
(Novolin R) | 0.5 to 1 hr. | 2 to 3 hr. | 5 to 7 hr.  |
|  Intermediate acting | neutral protamine
Hagedorn(NPH)
insulin (Humulin N),
lente insulin | 1 to 2 hr. | 4 to 12 hr. | 18 to 24 hr.  |
|  Long acting | Ultra lente, Insulin
glargine (Luntus) | 1 hr. | None | 10.4 to 24 hr.  |</p>
<p>Premixed insulins</p>
<ul>
<li>70% NPH and 30% Regular (Humulin 70/30) – mixture of intermediate acting and short-acting insulin</li>
<li>75% insulin lispro protamine and 25% insulin lispro (Humalog 75/25) – mixture of intermediate acting and rapid-acting insulin Complications</li>
</ul>
<p>SIDE/ADVERSE EFFECTS NURSING INTERVENTIONS/CLIENT EDUCATION</p>
<p>Risk for hypoglycemia (too much insulin)</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Monitor clients for signs of hypoglycemia. If abrupt onset, client will experience sympathetic nervous system (SNS) symptoms (tachycardia, palpitations, diaphoresis, shakiness). If gradual onset, client will experience parasympathetic (PNS) symptoms (headache, tremors, weakness).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Administer glucose. For conscious clients, administer a snack of 15 g of carbohydrate (4 oz. orange juice, 2 oz. grape juice, 8 oz. milk, glucose tablets per manufacturer’s suggestion to equal 15 g).</p>
</li>
<li></li>
</ul>
<p>If the client is not fully conscious, do not risk aspiration. Administer glucose parenterally such as IV glucose, or SC/IM glucagon.</p>
<ul>
<li>Encourage clients to wear a medical alert bracelet.</li>
</ul>
<p>Lipohypertrophy</p>
<ul>
<li>atrophy of the sub cutaneous fat at the site of insulin injection is probably an immune response to insulin.</li>
<li>It may occur with human insulin if patients inject themselves repeatedly in the same site</li>
<li>Instruct clients to systematically rotate injection sites and to allow 1 inch between injection sites.</li>
</ul>
<p>Insulin allergy resistant</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>identify the underlying cause.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>If allergic reaction to porcine insulin human insulin should be used.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Antihistamines may provide relieve in patients with cutaneous reaction.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Glucocorticoids are used in patients with resistant to insulin or more severe systemic reactions</p>
</li>
<li></li>
</ul>
<p>Drug interaction</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Drug interaction is often caused by ethanol, adrenergic receptor antagonist, and salicylates.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Adrenergic receptor antagonist pose a risk of hypoglycemia due to inhibition of catecholamine effects on gluconeogenesis and glycogenolysis.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>These agents may also mask he autonomic symptoms associated with hypoglycemia.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Salicylates enhance cell sensitivity to glucose and potentiate insulin secretion and also have a weak insulin – like action in the periphery.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Epinephrine, glucocorticoid, atypical antipsychotic drugs such as clozapine and olanzapine, and ARVS (protease inhibitors) have direct effects on peripheral tissues that counter the effect of insulin.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Phenytoin, clonidine, ca2+channel blockers cause hyperglycemia by inhibiting insulin secretion directly or in directly via depletion of K+ (diuretics).</p>
</li>
<li></li>
</ul>
<p>Nursing education</p>
<p>• Ensure proper storage of insulin.</p>
<p>✓ Unopened vials of a single type of insulin may be stored in the refrigerator until their expiration date.</p>
<p>✓ Vials of premixed insulins may be stored for up to 3 months.</p>
<p>✓ Insulins premixed in syringes may be kept for 1 to 2 weeks under refrigeration. Keep the syringes in a vertical position, with the needles pointing up. Prior to administration, the insulin should be resuspended by gently moving the syringe.</p>
<p>✓ Store the vial that is in use at room temperature, avoiding proximity to sunlight and intense heat. Discard after 1 month.</p>
<ul>
<li></li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li>Administer NPH by subcutaneous route.</li>
<li>Instruct clients to administer SC insulin in one general area to have consistent rates of absorption. Absorption rates from subcutaneous tissue increase from thigh to upper arm to abdomen.</li>
<li>Use only insulin-specific syringes that correspond to the concentration of insulin being administered. Administer U-100 insulin with a U-100 syringe; administer U-500 insulin with a U-500 syringe.</li>
<li>Select an appropriate needle length to ensure insulin is injected into subcutaneous tissue versus intradermal (too short) or intramuscular (too long).</li>
<li>Encourage clients to enhance their diabetes medication therapy with a proper diet and consistent activity</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li>
<p>For insulin suspensions, the nurse should gently rotate the vial between his or her palms to disperse the particles throughout the vial prior to withdrawing insulin.</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Do not administer short-acting insulins if they appear cloudy or discolored.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Insulin glargine and insulin detemir are both clear in color, not administered IV, and should not be mixed in a syringe with any other insulin.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Administer lispro, aspart, glulisine, and regular insulin by subcutaneous injection, continuous subcutaneous infusion, and IV route.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Adjust the client’s insulin dosage to meet insulin needs.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The client’s dosage may need to be increased in response to the client’s increase in caloric intake, infection, stress, growth spurts, and in the second and third trimesters of pregnancy.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The client’s dosage may need to be reduced in response to level of exercise or first trimester of pregnancy.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<table><thead><tr><th>Oral hypoglycemic</th><th>Classification</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Medications</td><td>Expected pharmacological action</td></tr><tr><td>Sulfonylureas</td><td></td></tr></tbody></table>
<ul>
<li>1st generation - tolbutamide (Orinase), chlorpropamide (Diabinese)</li>
<li>2nd generation - glipizide (Glucotrol, Glucotrol XL) ,glyburide (DiaBeta, Micronase , glibenclamide) glimepiride (Amaryl) | Results in insulin release from the pancreas  |
|  Meglitinides repaglinide (Prandin) nateglinide (Starlix) | Results in insulin release from the pancreas  |
|  Biguanides
metformin HCl (Glucophage) | - Reduces the production of glucose within the liver through suppression of gluconeogenesis</li>
<li>Increases muscles' glucose uptake and use  |
|  Thiazolidinedione's (Glitazones) , rosiglitazone (Avandia), pioglitazone (Actos) | - Increases cellular response to insulin by decreasing insulin resistance</li>
<li>Results in increased glucose uptake and decreased glucose production  |
|  Alpha glucosidase inhibitors acarbose (Precose), miglitol (Glyset) | - Slows carbohydrate absorption and digestion  |
|  Gliptins - Sitagliptin (Januvia | - Augments naturally occurring incretin hormones, which  |</li>
</ul>
<p>Therapeutic Uses</p>
<p>• All classifications of oral hypoglycemic agents control blood glucose levels in clients with type 2 diabetes mellitus and are used in conjunction with diet and exercise lifestyle changes.</p>
<p>Metformin HCl is used to treat polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).</p>
<p>SIDE/ADVERSE EFFECTS</p>
<p>Glipizide and repaglinide</p>
<p>• Hypoglycemia</p>
<p>metformin</p>
<p>• Gastrointestinal effects (anorexia, nausea, vomiting, which frequently results in weight loss of 3 to 4 kg [6 to 8 lb])</p>
<p>• Vitamin B12 and folic acid deficiency caused by altered absorption</p>
<p>• Lactic acidosis (hyperventilation, myalgia, sluggishness, somnolence) – 50% mortality rate</p>
<p>Rosiglitazone</p>
<p>• Fluid Rosiglitazone retention</p>
<p>• Elevations in low density lipoproteins (LDL) cholesterol</p>
<p>• Hepatotoxicity .</p>
<p>Side/ adverse effects</p>
<p>acarbose</p>
<p>• Intestinal effects (abdominal distention and cramping, hyperactive bowel sounds, diarrhea, excessive gas).</p>
<p>• Risk for anemia due to the decrease of iron absorption</p>
<p>• Hepatoxicity with long-term use</p>
<p>Sitagliptin</p>
<p>• generally well tolerated</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="contraindications-precautions">Contraindications/Precautions<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#contraindications-precautions" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Pregnancy Risk Category C: Glipizide, repaglinide, rosiglitazone</li>
<li>Pregnancy Risk Category B: Metformin HCl (Glucophage), acarbose (Precose), sitagliptin (Januvia)</li>
<li>These oral agents are generally avoided in pregnancy and lactation, but the provider may decide to prescribe them.</li>
<li>Use cautiously in clients with renal failure, hepatic dysfunction, or heart failure because of the risk of medication accumulation and resulting hypoglycemia. Severity of disease may indicate contraindication.</li>
<li>Contraindicated in the treatment of diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) Metformin HCl is contraindicated for clients with severe infection, shock, and any hypoxic condition.</li>
<li>Acarbose is contraindicated for clients with gastrointestinal disorders, such as inflammatory disease, ulceration, or obstruction.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="medication-interaction">Medication interaction<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#medication-interaction" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="class-sept-2021"><strong>CLASS: SEPT 2021</strong><span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#class-sept-2021" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="facilitator-jonah-nyachae"><strong>FACILITATOR: Jonah Nyachae</strong><span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#facilitator-jonah-nyachae" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251214-3f177338.jpeg" alt="img-1.jpeg"></p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="broad-objective">BROAD OBJECTIVE<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#broad-objective" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>By the end of the block, learners will gain knowledge on the use of pharmacological agents in the prevention and treatment of diseases.</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251214-aeef6ce5.jpeg" alt="img-2.jpeg"></p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="specific-objectives">Specific objectives<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#specific-objectives" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>To review principles of pharmacologic agents
To describe specific classes of pharmacologic agents;</p>
<ol>
<li>Their mechanism of action</li>
<li>General spectrum</li>
<li>Contraindications</li>
<li>Drug interactions</li>
<li>Side effects</li>
<li>Nurses responsibility</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="outline">Outline<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#outline" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Antimicrobials</li>
<li>Antiseptics and disinfectants</li>
<li>Respiratory drugs</li>
<li>Cardiovascular drugs</li>
<li>Haemopoietic drugs</li>
<li>Cancer agents</li>
<li>GIT drugs</li>
<li>CNS drugs</li>
<li>Others</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="review-introductory-pharrm">Review introductory pharrm,<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#review-introductory-pharrm" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Pharmacokinetics-what the body does to a drug{the movement of drug into, through, and out of the body}-the time course of its</li>
<li>Absorption</li>
<li>Bioavailability</li>
<li>Distribution</li>
<li>Metabolism</li>
<li>Excretion</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="p-kinetics-determined-by">P'KINETICS DETERMINED BY:-<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#p-kinetics-determined-by" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Compliance</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Dosing</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Absorption</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Medication errors</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Tissue mass</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Body fluid volume</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Drug interactions</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Elimination</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Metabolism</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Pharmacodynamics</strong>—what a drug does to the body, involves:</p>
<ul>
<li>Receptor binding</li>
<li>Postreceptor effects</li>
<li>Chemical interactions.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>P'kinetics determines the</p>
<ul>
<li>Onset</li>
<li>Duration</li>
<li>Intensity of a drug's effect.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251214-c5ba7caa.jpeg" alt="img-3.jpeg"></p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="p-dynamics-determined-by">P'dynamics determined by:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#p-dynamics-determined-by" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Drug receptor status</li>
<li>Genetic factors</li>
<li>Drug interactions</li>
<li>Tolerance</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="antibacterial-drugs">ANTIBACTERIAL DRUGS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#antibacterial-drugs" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251214-2609a949.jpeg" alt="img-4.jpeg"></p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="bacterial-cell-structure">BACTERIAL CELL STRUCTURE<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#bacterial-cell-structure" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="capsule">Capsule<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#capsule" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="cell-wall">Cell wall<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#cell-wall" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="cell-membrane">Cell membrane<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#cell-membrane" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="ribosome">Ribosome<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#ribosome" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="chromosome-dna">Chromosome (DNA)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#chromosome-dna" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="nucleoid-region">Nucleoid region<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#nucleoid-region" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="flagellum">Flagellum<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#flagellum" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251214-c3080632.jpeg" alt="img-6.jpeg"></p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="important-terms">Important terms<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#important-terms" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Antibiotics - substances produced by microorganisms that in very dilute conc. kill or inhibit other microorganisms</li>
<li>Bacteriostatic - agents that inhibit the growth (replication) of the infective agent.</li>
<li>The body requires an effective immune defense.</li>
<li>Bacteriocidal - agents that kills the sensitive infective agent. The body does not requires an effective immune system.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="post-antibiotic-effect">Post antibiotic effect<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#post-antibiotic-effect" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>Persistent microbial suppression even after the plasma concentration of a drug falls below the minimum inhibitory concentration.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="spectrum">Spectrum<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#spectrum" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>The extent of coverage of a chemotherapeutic agent i.e.</p>
<ul>
<li>☑ Narrow – sensitivity limited to a small group of organisms</li>
<li>☑ Broad – many groups of organisms sensitive to the effect of that agent (often inclusive of both gram +ve &amp; -ve)</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251214-20df035b.jpeg" alt="img-7.jpeg"></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Beta-lactam: a ring in the general organic structure of some antibiotics e.g. penicillins</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Beta-lactamase-an enzyme produced by some bacteria.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Indication:- situation in which a drug should be administered</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Contraindication:-situation in which a drug should NEVER be administered</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Side effect:-other drug effects outside the therapeutic effects.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Resistance:-adaptive mxns to escape the effects of chemotherapeutic agents.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="major-targets-of-antibacterials">Major targets of antibacterials<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#major-targets-of-antibacterials" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>i. Different precursor/substrate requirements.
ii. Different enzymes or enzyme sensitivity or importance.
iii. Different formed structures and their synthesis and composition e.g. cell wall.
iv. DNA and RNA synthesis.
v. Different receptors.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="classes-of-antibacterials">Classes of antibacterials<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#classes-of-antibacterials" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="cell-wall-synthesis-inhibitors">Cell wall synthesis inhibitors-<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#cell-wall-synthesis-inhibitors" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Beta-lactams (penicillins,cephalosporins, carbapenems,monobactams).</li>
<li>Vancomycin &amp; teicoplanin</li>
<li>Bacitracin etc</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="protein-synthesis-inhibitors">Protein synthesis inhibitors<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#protein-synthesis-inhibitors" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Tetracylines</li>
<li>Aminoglycosides</li>
<li>Chloramphenicol</li>
<li>Macrolides</li>
<li>Lincosamides</li>
<li>Spectinomycin</li>
<li>Fusidic acid</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="antifolates">Antifolates<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#antifolates" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="sulphonamides">Sulphonamides<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#sulphonamides" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="trimethoprim">Trimethoprim<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#trimethoprim" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="rifamycins">Rifamycins<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#rifamycins" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="cell-membrane-disruptors">Cell membrane disruptors<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#cell-membrane-disruptors" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>Polymixins,colistin</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="antimycobacterials">Antimycobacterials<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#antimycobacterials" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="srhze-dapsone-ethionamide-etc">SRHZE, dapsone, Ethionamide etc<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#srhze-dapsone-ethionamide-etc" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="miscellaneous">Miscellaneous<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#miscellaneous" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Metronidazole,Nitrofurantoin,methamine,Mu
pirocin</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="beta-lactam-compounds">BETA-LACTAM COMPOUNDS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#beta-lactam-compounds" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Mxn: Bind to PBP- and other proteins thus interfering with cross linking &amp; morphology by activation of remodeling proteins causing autolysis of the cell.</li>
<li>Active only in organisms whose cell wall is formed of peptidoglycan</li>
<li>All are bacteriocidal</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="penicillins-general">Penicillins (general)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#penicillins-general" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Adm - pareteral (Acid labile) e.g pen. G; Oral (Acid stable) e.g. pen V.</li>
<li>Distribution: Wide
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">✓</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\checkmark</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6922em;"></span><span class="mord amsrm">✓</span></span></span></span></span> Enters inflamed meninges (CSF)
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">✓</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\checkmark</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6922em;"></span><span class="mord amsrm">✓</span></span></span></span></span> Some bind to proteins.
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">✓</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\checkmark</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6922em;"></span><span class="mord amsrm">✓</span></span></span></span></span> High plasma conc. Achieved.</li>
<li>Elimination: by kidneys(tubular secretion)</li>
</ul>
<p>Short <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mo>&lt;</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">t_{1 / 2}(&lt;2 \mathrm{hr})</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.1052em; vertical-align: -0.3552em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">t</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3448em;"><span style="top: -2.5198em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1/2</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3552em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mrel">&lt;</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">hr</span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span> - multiple dosing</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="side-effects">Side effects<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#side-effects" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Hypersensitivity rxns - fever, itching, rashes, angioneurotic edema anaphylactic shock.</li>
<li>Alteration of GIT flora - diarrhea, opportunistic infections (esp with prolonged Rx and high doses)</li>
<li>Blood disorders - neutropenia, anemia</li>
<li>Electrolyte imbalance (as Na or K salts) -CHF, HPT, renal diseases</li>
<li>Convulsions - with v. high doses</li>
</ul>
<p>Three groups of penicillins</p>
<ol>
<li>Natural Penicillins
• β-lactamase sensitive,
• Covers: Gm+ve cocci &amp; rods, gm-ve cocci, spirochetes, (little activity against gm-ve rods)
• Examples</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li>Benzylpenicillin</li>
<li>Procaine penicillin</li>
<li>Benzathine penicillin</li>
<li>Phenoxymethylpenicillin</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="2-antistaphylococcal-penicillins">2. Antistaphylococcal penicillins<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#2-antistaphylococcal-penicillins" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Narrow spectrum, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\beta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span></span></span></span></span>-lactamase resistant, most acid stable
Examples:</li>
<li>Oxacillin</li>
<li>Cloxacillin</li>
<li>Dicloxacillin</li>
<li>Flucloxacillin</li>
<li>Methicillin</li>
<li>Nafcillin</li>
<li>Uses: <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\beta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span></span></span></span></span>-lactamase producing staph infections - bone, joint</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="3-extended-spectrum-penicillins">3. Extended spectrum penicillins<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-extended-spectrum-penicillins" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Antipseudomonal penicillins, broad spectrum, blactamase sensitive, most parenteral examples:Piperacillin, carbenicillin, tircacillin, azlocillin, mezlocillin</li>
<li>Others: Ampicillin, amoxicillin, bacampicillin, pivampicillin, talampicillin</li>
<li>Uses: Respiratory infections,Sinusitis,Otitis media,UTIs, Listeriosis (DOC), Gm -ve cocci, Prophyl-dental procedures</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="beta-lactamase-inhibitors">Beta-lactamase inhibitors<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#beta-lactamase-inhibitors" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo mathvariant="normal">≠</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\neq</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mrel"><span class="mrel"><span class="mord vbox"><span class="thinbox"><span class="rlap"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="inner"><span class="mord"><span class="mrel"></span></span></span><span class="fix"></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mrel">=</span></span></span></span></span></span> Clavulanic acid
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo mathvariant="normal">≠</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\neq</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mrel"><span class="mrel"><span class="mord vbox"><span class="thinbox"><span class="rlap"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="inner"><span class="mord"><span class="mrel"></span></span></span><span class="fix"></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mrel">=</span></span></span></span></span></span> Sulbactam
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo mathvariant="normal">≠</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\neq</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mrel"><span class="mrel"><span class="mord vbox"><span class="thinbox"><span class="rlap"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="inner"><span class="mord"><span class="mrel"></span></span></span><span class="fix"></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mrel">=</span></span></span></span></span></span> Tazobactam</p>
<ul>
<li>These bind to and inactivate the <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\beta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span></span></span></span></span>-lactamase enzyme.</li>
<li>Combined with some penicillins to increase the spectrum to cover <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\beta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span></span></span></span></span>-lactamase producing organisms</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="e-g-amoxicillin-clavulanate-augmentin">E.g. Amoxicillin+Clavulanate <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">=</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span></span></span></span></span> augmentin<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#e-g-amoxicillin-clavulanate-augmentin" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="primary-mxns-of-bacterial-resistance">Primary mxns of bacterial resistance<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#primary-mxns-of-bacterial-resistance" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Production of beta-lactarnases, which cleave the beta-lactam ring structure</li>
<li>Change in penicillin-binding proteins</li>
<li>Change in porins</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="benzylpenicillin-prototype">Benzylpenicillin-prototype<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#benzylpenicillin-prototype" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="indications">- Indications<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#indications" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Infections caused by: streptococci, meningococci, enterococci, penicillin-susceptible pneumococci, non-lactamase-producing staphylococci, Treponema pallidum and many other spirochetes, clostridium species, actinomyces, and other gram-positive rods and non- -lactamase-producing gram-negative anaerobic organisms.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="contraindications">Contraindications:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#contraindications" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>-Penicillin hypersensitive
Route: IM &amp; IV</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="dose">Dose:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#dose" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Adults: 1-4 mU q4-6h</li>
<li>Paediatrics: 25,000-400,000 units/kg/d in 4-6 doses</li>
<li>Neonates: 75,000-150,000 units/kg/d in 2 or 3 doses</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="precautions">Precautions<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#precautions" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Use cautiously in patients with other drug allergies, esp. cephalosporins-possible cross-sensitivity.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="drug-interactions">Drug interactions<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#drug-interactions" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Aminoglycosides</li>
<li>Hormonal contraceptives</li>
<li>Oral anticoagulants</li>
<li>Probenecid.</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251214-86a813e9.jpeg" alt="img-8.jpeg"></p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="side-effects">Side effects<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#side-effects" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Hypersensitivity reactions</li>
<li>CNS: neuropathy, seizures, anxiety, confusion etc</li>
<li>CV: heart failure, thrombophlebitis.</li>
<li>GI: enterocolitis, ischemic colitis, nausea, vomiting...</li>
<li>GU: nephropathy, interstitial nephritis.</li>
<li>Hematologic: hemolytic anemia, leukopenia, thrombocytopenia,</li>
<li>Musculoskeletal: arthralgia.</li>
<li>Others: OI's, pain at injection site, vein irritation.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="nursing-considerations">NURSING CONSIDERATIONS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#nursing-considerations" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Observe patient closely.</li>
<li>With large doses and prolonged therapy, bacterial or fungal superinfection may occur, especially in elderly, debilitated, or immunosuppressed patients.</li>
<li>Look alike-sound alike: Don't confuse with Polycillin, penicillamine, or the various types of penicillin.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="patient-teaching">PATIENT TEACHING<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#patient-teaching" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Tell patient to report adverse reactions promptly.</li>
<li>Instruct patient to report discomfort at I.V. site.</li>
<li>Warn patient receiving I.M. injection that the injection may be painful.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="cephalosporins">Cephalosporins<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#cephalosporins" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
